availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles W. Johnstone (Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and railroad ticket agent)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and railroad ticket agent. Kentucky native. Son of James Johnstone and Ellen C. Johnstone. Married to Fleecie A. Winn Johnstone in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on October 5, 1864. Attended school in Louisville in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Clerk in Louisville in 1861. Ticket agent for the Jeffersonville and Indianapolis Railroad Company in Louisville in 1865.
